alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 11:05AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL LOS ANGELES COUNTY THROUGH NOON PST... At 1103 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Long Beach, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent lightning and possible small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Beach...Downtown Los Angeles...Pasadena...Whittier... West Covina...Glendora...Buena Park...La Habra...Altadena... La Canada Flintridge...Carson...Eagle Rock...Glendale... Port of Los Angeles...Artesia...Baldwin Park...and Commerce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
